page.title: 16NEED HELP? COVENTRY S.W.
page.content: {The Information Centre}first opened in 1971 to help local people find their way around and to help with problems other than legal.If someone wants to find a bed for the night the Centre will find one if they can.If they do they charge 75p.For tourists they have set up a 'Tourist Trail'where someone takes them around the sights of Coventry.Lots of people visit the Information Centre: in one year 133,397 people visited it.At the Information Centre guide books,maps, leaflets and pictures are available at a cost but some are free.If you want to see some places of interest you can either ring up or visit the Centre at 36 Broadgate.However soon it is moving to smaller premises.7 staff work at the centre which is open every day but Sunday and every Bank Holiday but Christmas.
